FuncDef:
The mode channel enable command enables channelization on a sub-interface.
The undo mode channel enable command disables channelization on a sub-interface.
By default, channelization is not enabled on a sub-interface.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In network slicing scenarios, to enable channelization on a sub-interface of an Ethernet physical interface, run the mode channel enable command. This configuration creates a channelized sub-interface and implements independent HQoS rate limiting.
Prerequisites
The encapsulation mode of a sub-interface has been set to dot1q using the vlan-type dot1q vlan-id command.
To activate the license for a channelized sub-interface, run the active port-mode-channel command.
There is no need to activate the license for a channelized sub-interface on a GE interface.
Precautions
Channelization of a sub-interface is mutually exclusive with a BRAS service.
Channelization of a sub-interface is mutually exclusive with MPLS TE tunnel traffic policing.
Channelization of a sub-interface is mutually exclusive with VPN QoS tunnel traffic policing.
Channelization of a sub-interface is mutually exclusive with PIM SIM service.
